intro: Sida rubriramea, commonly known as red-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Sida rubriramea is typically found in moist habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks.
